pages.text: The $(thing)Lava Basin$() is a device similar to the $(thing)Fire Box$(); it is used to burn fuel to produce heat. In this instance, $(thing)Lava$() is used as fuel.$(br2)The Lava Basin can hold 1000mB, or 1 bucket, of lava. Each 100mB of lava will last 2 hours and will heat to $(bold)White$().
The $(thing)Lava Basin$() is made with fire bricks and a blue steel double sheet.$(br2)Once lava is in the tank, it will start to be consumed.

The $(thing)Lava Basin$() does not require a chimney to operate. Furthermore, a $(l:mechanics/bellows)Bellows$() has no effect on the temperature.$(br2)Similar to the Fire Box, it cannot heat items on its own; its usefulness comes when paired with a heat-consuming device, like a $(l:mechanics/crucible)Crucible$() or $(thing)Steam Generator$().

pages.title: Maintenance
pages.text: As the $(thing)Lava Basin$() consumes fuel, it will accumulate a layer of slag. As the slag builds up, the maximum operating temperature will lower by $(thing)5Â°$() per 100mB.$(br2)To maintain its efficiency, click the $(thing)Empty Slag$() button to remove the build-up.
